OBJECTIVE Description
OBJECTIVE 16-1 Discuss the role of a company’s salespeople in creating value for customers and building customer relationships.
Personal Selling (pp 480–482)
OBJECTIVE 16-2 Identify and explain the six major sales force management steps.
Managing the Sales Force (pp 482–493)
OBJECTIVE 16-3 Discuss the personal selling process, distinguishing between transaction-oriented marketing and relationship marketing.
The Personal Selling Process (pp 493–496)
OBJECTIVE 16-4 Explain how sales promotion campaigns are developed and implemented.
Sales Promotion (pp 496–503)
summary_markdown: This table outlines four key objectives related to personal selling and sales force management. Objective 16-1 focuses on the fundamental role of salespeople in customer value creation and relationship building, referencing the concept of Personal Selling. Objective 16-2 delves into the six essential steps involved in managing a sales force. Objective 16-3 examines the stages of the personal selling process, differentiating between transaction-oriented and relationship marketing approaches. Finally, Objective 16-4 addresses the development and implementation of sales promotion campaigns. The structure is hierarchical, moving from the foundational role of salespeople to the management and process of selling, and concluding with sales promotion strategies.
